To make best use of all features PRISMCUBE RUBY provides, connecting with two cables from the same satellite dish is strongly recommended. This will allow you to view and record different channels and record two channels at the same time. The second channel you can view while recording a live programme will be limited if connecting with a single cable using loop through.

PIP (Picture in picture) is a function that allows you to watch two programmes simultaneously.[CR]Some tips to remember when using PIP are as follow.[CR][CR]- Engage the PIP feature by pressing BLUE button on the remote; a small box should appear in one corner of the screen.[CR]- Change the channel in the PIP window by pressing number keys on the remote after turning Num Lock on.[CR]- You can also access and use the PIP while you are watching video in XBMC.

You can delete, move, select, rename or lock the channels conveniently in the Channel List window.[CR][CR]1. Press the i button to display the channel list context menu and select EDIT CHANNELS.[CR]2. Select the channels you want to delete by pressing OK button.[CR]3. Press the i button again and select DELETE and press OK button to delete the channels previously selected.[CR]4. Press SAVE AND EXIT on the context menu.[CR]5. When a message asking for confirmation will appear, press YES to save.

The entire channels in the channel list are often too many to navigate. Sort the channels that you watch more often in a favorite channel group.[CR][CR]1. Select CREATE NEW FAVORITE GROUP on the channel list context menu and Press OK button.[CR]2. Enter a name for your favorite channel group.[CR]3. Press DONE to confirm.

XBMC is an entertainment hub for digital media that can be used to play almost all popular audio and video formats from your hard drive. XBMC allows the user to install new add-ons like YouTube, Flickr, as well as skins from the repository installed.
installing_addons.png

Add-ons are packages that add features and functions not normally included with XBMC.[CR][CR]1. Select PRISMCUBE'S ADD-ONS and press OK.[CR]2. Scroll down to the category you want and press OK.[CR]3. Select the add-on you want to install.[CR]4. A summary dialog will be brought up allowing you see various properties of the add-on.[CR]5. Select INSTALL to begin automatic downloading and installing.

page.title: Updating Add-ons
page.location: (MEDIA > ADD-ON MANAGER > PRESS LEFT or RIGHT BUTTON)

content.name: updating_addons.png

All installed add-ons will be automatically updated when new versions are available from the repositories.[CR]If Auto update is turned off you should see a folder in the Add-on manager that says Available Updates, where you can go in and one-by-one and update add-ons.
running_addons.png

When the add-on has finished downloading, XBMC will enable it and depending on the add-on ask if you want to start using it. Add-ons will then appear in their appropriate section. ( e.g. Flickr in the pictures, YouTube in the video section of Media, etc )
